snippet: Education officials in northwestern Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Province have renamed more than a hundred schools after the children killed last year in a Taliban attack on an army-run public school in Peshawar.
abstract: Pakistan's Directorate of Elementary and Secondary Education announces that 107 schools will be renamed in honor of children killed in 2014 Taliban attack on Army Public School in Peshawar.
lead_paragraph: Education officials in northwestern Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Province have renamed more than a hundred schools after the children killed last year in a Taliban attack on an army-run public school in Peshawar.

headline.main: Pakistan Honors Victims of School Massacre
headline.print_headline: Pakistan Honors Victims of a Massacre

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Army Public School and Degree College (Peshawar, Pakistan)
